overview:
## Return Value

The identifier of the sound to be played. Return `nil` if you want to let the parent focus environment determine which sound to play.

## Discussion

Use this method to return a custom sound when the focus environment object gains focus. Return [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIFocusSoundIdentifier/default] to play the default system sound, or return [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIFocusSoundIdentifier/none] to avoid playing a sound altogether. If you previously registered custom sounds using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIFocusSystem/register(_:forSoundIdentifier:)] method of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIFocusSystem], you may also return an identifier for a sound that you registered.

If you do not implement this method, the system assumes a `nil` return value. If no ancestor environment defines a custom sound, the system plays the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIFocusSoundIdentifier/default] sound.

# soundIdentifierForFocusUpdate(in:)

**Instance Method**

Asks the delegate for the identifier of the sound to play when the object gains focus.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func soundIdentifierForFocusUpdate(in context: UIFocusUpdateContext) -> UIFocusSoundIdentifier?
```

## Parameters

- **context**: The context object associated with the update.

## Return Value

The identifier of the sound to be played. Return `nil` if you want to let the parent focus environment determine which sound to play.

## Discussion

Use this method to return a custom sound when the focus environment object gains focus. Return [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIFocusSoundIdentifier/default] to play the default system sound, or return [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIFocusSoundIdentifier/none] to avoid playing a sound altogether. If you previously registered custom sounds using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIFocusSystem/register(_:forSoundIdentifier:)] method of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIFocusSystem], you may also return an identifier for a sound that you registered.

If you do not implement this method, the system assumes a `nil` return value. If no ancestor environment defines a custom sound, the system plays the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIFocusSoundIdentifier/default] sound.



## Getting the sound to play during updates

- **Using custom sounds for focus movement**: Customize the sounds users hear when focus moves.
- **UIFocusSoundIdentifier**: An identifier for a focus-related sound.
